document.masterDocTitle: On some Maerid genera (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Maeridae) collected by the Hourglass Cruises (Florida). Part 1: Genera Anamaera, Ceradocus, Clessidra gen. nov., Jerbarnia, Maera, Meximaera, with a key to world Ceradocus

caption.paragraph:
Figure 2. Character matrix for all known species of
Ceradocus
. Explanation of characters is supplied in Table 1.

Table 1. The characters used in the matrix for
Ceradocus species
; see also Figure 2.

subSubSection.paragraph: 0: art 3 shorter than half of art2
7. Gn 2 male larger: propodus ratio length: breadth 0: <1.5
0: serrated or at least one small tooth
21. U3 ratio external ramus ratio length: breadth
*Remarks on epimeral plates: authors have a
different opinion about the posterodistal corner of
the epimeral plates; we agree with Jerry Barnard
defining the corner as the end of the ridge, not the

caption.paragraph:
Figure 3.
Ceradocus sheardi Shoemaker
: 1 male 9 mm, FSBC I 44884. Mdp, mandible palp; Mx1, maxilla 1; Mx2, maxilla 2; LL, lower lip; Gn1, gnathopod 1; Gn2, gnathopod 2.

Figure 4.
Ceradocus sheardi Shoemaker
: 1 male 9 mm, FSBC I 44884. P7, peraeopod 7; Ep1–3, epimeral plates 1–3; Us1, Us2, urosome segment 1,2; U1–3, uropod 1–3; underneath enlargement of tips of U1; T, telson.

subSubSection.paragraph: Gn2 not sexually dimorphic, not asymmetrical, palmar margin sinuous, without processes. P7 basis with posteroventral angle rectangular, not projecting into acute lobe. Pleon segments with strong teeth and serrations. Ep1–3 serrated. Us segments 1,2 with teeth. T lobes acutely ending, with strong subapical robust seta (and small additional ones).

Rubble zone, lagoon, forereef, 1–2 m : under rocks on sandy bottoms ( Thomas, 1993 ); down to 52 m ( Thomas, 1993 ). Here down to
73 m .

Pure transparent white; U1,2 rami faint salmon pink; eyes dark red, divisions white [Shoemaker’s unpublished colour notes based on live material from Dry Tortugas ( fide LeCroy 2000 )]; ivory ( Thomas 1993 ).
